definitions.definition: the state of having, owning, or controlling something.
examples: are you in possession of any items over $500 in value?
synonyms: guardianship More"the estate came into their possession"seize
requisition; distrain; informalget one's mitts on "they were under orders to take possession of the house and all of its contents"

definitions.definition: visible power or control over something, as distinct from lawful ownership; holding or occupancy.
examples: both teams attempting to gain possession of the ball

definitions.definition: the state of possessing an illegal drug.
(in football, basketball, and other ball games) temporary control of the ball by a particular player or team.
examples: the ball hit a defender and Brown's quick reaction put him in possession

definitions.definition: an item of property; something belonging to one.
examples: I was alone with no money or possessions

definitions.definition: a territory or country controlled or governed by another.
the state of being controlled by a demon or spirit.
examples: they prayed for protection against demonic possession

definitions.definition: the state of being completely under the influence of an idea or emotion.
examples: fear took possession of my soul
